citation.article-title: Propionigenium modestum gen. nov. sp. nov., a new strictly anaerobic nonsporing bacterium growing on succinate

p.s: Propionigenium (Pro.pi.o.ni.ge'ni.um. M.L.n. acidum propionicum propionic acid; L.v. genere, gignere make, produce; Propionigenium M.L. neutr, n. a propionic acid producer)
Rod-shaped to coccoid Gram-negative bacteria with rounded ends, single, in pairs, or in chains.
Media containing a reductant are necessary for growth.
Habitats: Anaerobic muds of freshwater or marine origin; also occurring as commensals of higher animals.
